question: cấp tính, buốt, nhói.
example: He got **acute**, spontaneous pains in his ears.
english-definition: if a bad situation is acute, it causes severe problems or damage.

question: sự hung hăng, sự gây hấn.
example: He lost the virtue of patience, and he became notorious for his **aggression**.
english-definition: spoken or physical behaviour that is threatening or involves harm to someone or something.

question: tiệc lớn, yến tiệc.
example: His final concert was held at a huge **banquet**.
english-definition: a large formal meal for many people.

question: tiểu sử, lý lịch.
example: Many **biographies** have been written that narrate his dominance in the music world.
english-definition: the life story of a person written by someone else.

question: thúc đẩy, nâng cao, làm tăng lên.
example: In that beautiful moment, the applause **boosted** his emotions, and he began to cry.
english-definition: to improve or increase something.

question: vỗ tay.
example: They **clapped** and cheered wildly.
english-definition: to make a short loud noise by hitting your hands together.

question: buộc phải, ép buộc.
example: His passion for music **compelled** him to keep performing even after he went deaf.
english-definition: to force someone to do something.

question: sự thống trị, sự áp đảo, ưu thế.
example: Many biographies have been written that narrate his **dominance** in the music world.
english-definition: the quality of being more important, strong, or successful than anything else of the same type.

question: lộng lẫy, rực rỡ, tuyệt đẹp.
example: He couldn’t hear himself play, but he knew that his creations sounded **gorgeous**.
english-definition: very beautiful or pleasant.

question: không thể tránh khỏi, tất yếu.
example: It was **inevitable** that he would eventually lose it altogether.
english-definition: certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented.

question: di sản, tài sản kế thừa.
example: Even though Beethoven is gone, his **legacy** will live on forever.
english-definition: money or property that you receive from someone after they die.

question: kiệt tác, tác phẩm lớn.
example: Even though millions of people got to hear his multiple **masterpieces**, he never did.
english-definition: a work of art such as a painting, film, or book that is made with great skill.

question: nhiều, nhiều phần.
example: Even though millions of people got to hear his **multiple** **masterpieces**, he never did.
english-definition: very many of the same type, or of different types.

question: tường thuật, kể lại.
example: Many biographies have been written that **narrate** his dominance in the music world.
english-definition: to tell a story, often by reading it aloud from a text, or to describe events as they happen.

question: khét tiếng, tai tiếng (vì điều gì đó xấu).
example: He lost the virtue of patience, and he became **notorious** for his aggression.
english-definition: famous for something bad.

question: lỗi thời, lạc hậu.
example: He didn’t survive the sickness, but his music did because great music never becomes **outdated**.
english-definition: old-fashioned and therefore not as good or as useful as something more modern.

question: nhìn chung, toàn bộ, toàn diện.
example: **Overall**, performance was one of the finest in history.
english-definition: in general rather than in particular, or including all the people or things in a particular group or situation.

question: sự thiên vị, sự yêu thích đặc biệt.
example: His **partiality** toward classical music developed when he was very young.
english-definition: the fact of unfairly preferring or supporting one person, group, or thing more than another.

question: tự phát, tự nhiên, không sắp đặt trước.
example: He got acute, **spontaneous** pains in his ears.
english-definition: happening or done in a natural, often sudden way, without any planning or encouragement.

question: đức tính tốt, đức hạnh.
example: He lost the **virtue** of patience, and he became notorious for his aggression.
english-definition: a good moral quality in a person, or the general quality of being morally good.

question: ngành nghiên cứu về con người, xã hội, văn hóa và sự phát triển của loài người
example: John was an **undergraduate** in college, and he studied **anthropology** and history.
english-definition: the study of humankind, especially its customs, beliefs, and relationships

question: vỗ tay tán thưởng
example: Everyone **applauded** the brothers’ good work.
english-definition: to show approval or praise by clapping hands

question: chỉ định, bổ nhiệm
example: One day, the mayor **appointed** Mark to build a monument: a statue of Egyptian Pharaoh, Tut.
english-definition: to choose someone for a job or position

question: tương thích, hợp nhau
example: “We worked together very well. I guess we are **compatible** after all,” Mark said.
english-definition: able to exist or occur together without conflict

question: năng lực, khả năng
example: However, he thought he had the **competence** to build a good statue anyway.
english-definition: the ability to do something successfully or efficiently

question: bàn bạc, hội ý
example: Mark **conferred** with John about every detail.
english-definition: to have discussions with someone in order to exchange opinions or get advice

question: liên tiếp, liên tục
example: For ten **consecutive** hours, the brothers worked.
english-definition: following one after another continuously

question: thô sơ, sơ sài
example: He made some **crude** measurements and sculpted a statue of a very old man with a tattoo on his chest.
english-definition: in a natural or raw state; not yet processed or refined

question: khối lập phương
example: Mark got another **cube** of stone.
english-definition: a symmetrical three-dimensional shape, either solid or hollow, contained by six equal squares

question: phản hồi, thông tin phản hồi
example: I’ll give you **feedback**, and we’ll make this a great monument.”
english-definition: information about reactions to a product, a person's performance of a task, etc., used as a basis for improvement

question: sự thiếu hiểu biết, sự dốt nát
example: John replied, “Your **ignorance** makes me laugh.
english-definition: lack of knowledge or information

question: nam tính
example: Mark looked very **masculine**.
english-definition: having qualities or appearance traditionally associated with men, especially strength and aggressiveness

question: đài tưởng niệm, tượng đài
example: One day, the mayor appointed Mark to build a **monument**: a statue of Egyptian Pharaoh, Tut.
english-definition: a statue, building, or other structure erected to commemorate a famous person or event

question: vạm vỡ, có cơ bắp
example: He had a mustache and was very **muscular**.
english-definition: having well-developed muscles

question: tư thế
example: “Make him tall with good **posture**,” John said.
english-definition: the position in which someone holds their body when standing or sitting

question: đặt ở, định vị
example: At last, the finished statue was **situated** in front of the museum.
english-definition: to place or locate in a particular position or array

question: giám sát
example: I’ll **supervise** your work.
english-definition: to observe and direct the execution of a task or activity

question: sự đối xứng
example: “And make sure there is **symmetry** in his body.”
english-definition: the quality of being made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis

question: hình xăm
example: He made some crude measurements and sculpted a statue of a very old man with a **tattoo** on his chest.
english-definition: a form of body modification where a design is made by inserting ink, dyes and pigments, either indelible or temporary, into the dermis layer of the skin to change the pigment.

question: sinh viên chưa tốt nghiệp đại học
example: John was an **undergraduate** in college, and he studied anthropology and history.
english-definition: a university student who has not yet taken a first degree
